angle.headline: The Blue Lot is Gone: The New Rules of SB60 Tailgating
angle.angle: The 'Multi-Agency Security Unification' has changed the map. SFPD and San Mateo units are enforcing strict codes in Santa Clara lots. The Media Compound has taken the Blue Lot. We map the new reality.

specific_facts: Blue Lot 1 is officially closed to the public, repurposed as the 'Media Compound' and broadcast truck staging area.
Green Lot 3 is the new primary tailgate zone, but capacity is reduced by 15% to accommodate widened fire lanes for 'Unified Command' emergency access.
Patrols in Santa Clara lots now include SFPD and San Mateo Sheriff deputies, who are enforcing a 'Zero Tolerance' policy on open containers outside designated tailgate footprints.
The 'Glass Ban' is being enforced at vehicle entry points; cars are being screened for glass bottles before parking.
Drones are strictly prohibited over all parking lots due to the FAA Temporary Flight Restriction (TFR) active from 10 AM.
sources_to_cite: Levi's Stadium SB60 Parking & Mobility Guide
On-site signage in Green Lot 3 ('Strict Enforcement Zone')
Interviews with Green Lot parking staff
key_quotes_stats: "It's not just Santa Clara cops anymore. You've got SFPD bike units who don't know the regulars."
"Blue Lot was the heart of the party. Now it's just cables and satellite trucks."
"If you are one inch over the painted line, they aren't asking you to move. They are ticketing."
counter_arguments_to_address: "I'll just park in the neighborhood and walk in." (Rebuttal: Residential zones are under 'Hard Lockdown' with VAP checkpoints).
"We'll tailgate at the golf course." (Rebuttal: The golf course is closed for VIP hospitality tents and the 'Clean Zone' buffer).
